qas.question: What is Kathmandu's fire department called?
What year saw the founding of Kathmandu's fire department?
When did Bhaktapur receive coverage from the fire department?
How many fire trucks did West Germany donate to Kathmandu?
What is the mission of FAN?

answers.text: raising public awareness about fire and improving safety

context: The fire service, known as the <a0_0>Barun Yantra Karyalaya<a0_0/>, opened its first station in Kathmandu in <a1_0>1937<a1_0/> with a single vehicle. An iron tower was erected to monitor the city and watch for fire. As a precautionary measure, firemen were sent to the areas which were designated as accident-prone areas. In <a2_0>1944<a2_0/>, the fire service was extended to the neighboring cities of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur. In 1966, a fire service was established in Kathmandu airport. In 1975, a West German government donation added <a3_0>seven<a3_0/> fire engines to Kathmandu's fire service. The fire service in the city is also overlooked by an international non-governmental organization, the Firefighters Volunteer Association of Nepal (FAN), which was established in 2000 with the purpose of <a4_0>raising public awareness about fire and improving safety<a4_0/>.
